sentences: Roberta Leslie Gourse (January 1, 1939  – December 23, 2004) was an American writer and biographer who was a prolific writer on jazz music and musicians.
In 1991, the American Society of Composers, Authors and Publishers awarded her the Deems Taylor Award for a series of seven articles in the magazine JazzTimes focusing on female jazz musicians.
Gourse was born in Fall River, Massachusetts, to Harva Zelda Fisher Gourse and Harry Andrew Gourse.
Shortly after her graduation in 1960, Gourse published her first novel, With Gall and Honey, a romantic novel set in Israel.
Gourse died as a result of respiratory problems in 2004.
Dizzy Gillespie and the Birth of Bebop (1995)
Unforgettable – Life and Mystique of Nat King Cole (2000)
Mahalia Jackson: Queen of Gospel Songs (1996)
The Art of the Great Jazz Bassists (1998) (with a foreword by Ron Carter)
Swingers and Crooners- The Art of Jazz Singing (1997)
